title: Footer burgundy/terracotta background via design tokens

requirements.summary: Introduce a dedicated footer background/foreground design token and update the footer to use it with readable contrast in light and dark mode.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx` no longer uses `bg-card` for the outer `<footer>` background; it uses a dedicated footer background utility (e.g., `bg-footer`).
A new footer color token is defined in `frontend/src/index.css` (e.g., `--footer` and, if needed, `--footer-foreground`) for both `:root` and `.dark`.

`frontend/tailwind.config.js` is extended to expose the footer token as a Tailwind color (e.g., `footer.DEFAULT` and optional `footer.foreground`) so `bg-footer` (and optionally `text-footer-foreground`) work.
All footer content (headings, paragraph text, links, bottom-bar text) remains clearly legible against the new burgundy/terracotta background in both light and dark mode.

file_operations.description: Add new CSS variables for the footer using the existing design-token approach: define `--footer` (burgundy/terracotta red background) and `--footer-foreground` (high-contrast text color) in both `:root` and `.dark`, ensuring the chosen OKLCH values maintain readable contrast.

Extend Tailwind theme colors to expose the new footer token(s): add `footer.DEFAULT` mapped to `--footer` (supporting `bg-footer`) and add `footer.foreground` mapped to `--footer-foreground` (supporting `text-footer-foreground`) consistent with existing token patterns.

Update the footer to use the dedicated footer background utility (replace `bg-card` with `bg-footer`) and adjust footer text/link classes to use the footer foreground token (e.g., `text-footer-foreground` and appropriate hover/focus states) so headings, body text, links, and bottom bar remain clearly legible in both light and dark mode without changing layout/spacing/links.
